package.node.label: Node.js v6.3+ via Inspector Protocol
package.node.sourceMaps.description: Use JavaScript source maps (if they exist).
package.node.outFiles.description: If source maps are enabled, these glob patterns specify the generated JavaScript files. If a pattern starts with `!` the files are excluded. If not specified, the generated code is expected in the same directory as its source.
package.node.port.description: Debug port to attach to. Default is 9229.
package.node.address.description: TCP/IP address of debug port. Default is 'localhost'.
package.node.timeout.description: Retry for this number of milliseconds to connect to Node.js. Default is 10000 ms.
package.node.smartStep.description: Automatically step through generated code that cannot be mapped back to the original source.
package.node.enableSourceMapCaching.description: When sourcemaps are downloaded from a URL, cache them to disk.
package.node.diagnosticLogging.description: When true, the adapter logs its own diagnostic info to the console
package.node.verboseDiagnosticLogging.descriptio: When true, the adaptor logs all traffic with the client and target (as well as the info logged by 'diagnosticLogging')
package.node.trace.description: When 'true', the debugger will log tracing info to a file. When 'verbose', it will also show logs in the console.
package.node.sourceMapPathOverrides.description: A set of mappings for rewriting the locations of source files from what the sourcemap says, to their locations on disk. See README for details.
package.node.skipFiles.description: An array of file or folder names, or glob patterns, to skip when debugging.
package.node.restart.description: Restart session after Node.js has terminated.
package.node.showAsyncStacks.description: Show the async calls that led to the current call stack.
package.node.disableOptimisticBPs.description: Don't set breakpoints in any file until a sourcemap has been loaded for that file.
package.node.launch.console.description: Where to launch the debug target: internal console, integrated terminal, or external terminal.
package.node.launch.args.description: Command line arguments passed to the programme.
package.node.launch.cwd.description: Absolute path to the working directory of the programme being debugged.
package.node.launch.runtimeExecutable.descriptio: Runtime to use. Either an absolute path or the name of a runtime available on the PATH. If ommitted `node` is assumed.
package.node.launch.runtimeArgs.description: Optional arguments passed to the runtime executable.
package.node.launch.env.description: Environment variables passed to the program. The value `null` removes the variable from the environment.
package.node.launch.envFile.description: Absolute path to a file containing environment variable definitions.
package.node.launch.outputCapture.description: From where to capture output messages: The debug API, or stdout/stderr streams.
package.node.launch.config.name: Launch
package.node.attach.processId.description: ID of process to attach to.
package.node.attach.localRoot.description: The local source root that corresponds to the 'remoteRoot'.
package.node.attach.remoteRoot.description: The source root of the remote host.
